info.title: InsightSentry API
info.description: Comprehensive financial data API providing access to global equities, indices, futures, options, cryptocurrencies, and forex markets with real-time and historical data.

get.summary: Recent historical data (up to 25k bars) with real-time data option
get.description: Retrieve recent historical OHLCV data with real-time data option for a symbol with configurable time intervals and adjustments
Retrieve historical data for specific time periods with deep archive access

parameters.name: start_ym
parameters.description: Starting period in YYYY-MM format for minute/hour intervals or YYYY-MM-DD for second intervals (UTC)

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a symbol including type, currency, market data, earnings dates, and option information
Retrieve trading session details including holidays, trading hours, timezone, and session corrections
Retrieve real-time quote data for up to 10 symbols

parameters.name: codes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of symbol codes in Exchange:Symbol format. Each code must match the SymbolCode pattern.

get.description: Search for financial instruments. This v3 endpoint differs from /v2/symbols/search. Use /v3 for paginated search results.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Each page returns up to 50 results.

has_more.description: Whether there are more results available

exchange.description: Exchange where the symbol is traded

country.description: Country where the symbol is from

get.description: Retrieve comprehensive fundamental data including company info, valuation ratios, profitability metrics, balance sheet, cash flow, income statement, and more

200.description: Successful response with fundamental data and values

get.description: Retrieve historical data for specific indicators. A maximum of 5 Indicator IDs can be requested at a time. The list of available Indicator IDs is provided in the fundamental_series and technical_series fields of the /v3/symbols/fundamentals endpoint. Some parameters may not apply to certain Indicator IDs, and not all indicators are supported for every symbol.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: (Required) Comma-separated list of indicator IDs (maximum 5). Available IDs can be retrieved from /v3/symbols/fundamentals endpoint's 'fundamental_series' and 'technical_series' fields.

200.description: Successful response with fundamental time series data

get.description: Retrieve the fundamentals schema and metadata. This endpoint returns the layout and definitions only â€” it does not include actual data, which are provided by /v3/symbols/{symbol}/fundamentals.

200.description: Successful response with fundamental metadata without values

get.description: Retrieve list of available option contracts for a given symbol
Retrieve option chain data for a specific expiration date
Retrieve option chain data for a specific strike price
Retrieve dividend calendar data for a specified time range
Retrieve earnings calendar data for a specified time range
Retrieve economic events calendar data for a specified time range
Retrieve latest financial news with optional keyword filtering

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: (Optional) Keywords to include items that match one of the keywords in the title or content, separated by a comma. e.g. apple,tesla

get.description: Retrieve the list of available fields and parameters for stock screening

post.description: Retrieve stock data based on specified filter criteria

allOf.description: Flexible request body similar to GraphQL. You can include any filter criteria beyond the fixed properties (fields, exchanges, countries, page, sortBy, sortOrder). Common examples include: market_cap_min, market_cap_max, volume_min, volume_max, price_min, price_max, etc.

get.description: Retrieve the list of available fields and parameters for ETF screening

post.description: Retrieve ETF data based on specified filter criteria

allOf.description: Flexible request body similar to GraphQL. You can include any filter criteria beyond the fixed properties (fields, exchanges, countries, page, sortBy, sortOrder). Common examples include: asset_class, expense_ratio_min, expense_ratio_max, aum_min, aum_max, etc.

get.description: Retrieve the list of available fields and parameters for bond screening

post.description: Retrieve bond data based on specified filter criteria

allOf.description: Flexible request body similar to GraphQL. You can include any filter criteria beyond the fixed properties (fields, exchanges, countries, page, sortBy, sortOrder). Common examples include: yield_min, yield_max, duration_min, duration_max, credit_rating, maturity_date_range, etc.

get.description: Retrieve the list of available fields and parameters for crypto screening

post.description: Retrieve cryptocurrency data based on specified filter criteria

fields.description: Array of field names to include in the response. You can find available fields in the Get Screener endpoint. At least one field must be specified, up to 10 fields maximum.

sortBy.description: Field name to sort by. It should be one of fields you specify. If not specified, it will sort by the symbol name.

get.description: Retrieve WebSocket Key, which expires every 7 days. This is only for RapidAPI users

expiration.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) when the key expires

OHLCV.description: Open, High, Low, Close, Volume data point

close.description: Close price of the bar or the last price for real-time data

bar_end.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) marking the end time of the most recent (or real-time) bar

last_update.description: The last update time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

bar_type.description: The type of bar used for historical data

QuoteData.description: Real-time quote information for a symbol

lp_time.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) of the last price update

volume.description: The trading volume for the symbol

last_price.description: The last traded price for the symbol

ask.description: The current lowest ask price for the symbol

bid.description: The current highest bid price for the symbol

ask_size.description: The size of the current ask order

bid_size.description: The size of the current bid order

market_cap.description: The market capitalization of the symbol

delay_seconds.description: The delay in seconds for the market data

prev_close_price.description: The previous trading day's closing price for the symbol

open_price.description: The opening price for the symbol

low_price.description: The lowest price for the symbol during the trading session

high_price.description: The highest price for the symbol during the trading session

exchange.description: Exchange where the symbol is traded

country.description: Country where the symbol is from

fields.description: Array of field names to include in the response. You can find available fields in the Get Screener endpoint. At least one field must be specified, up to 10 fields maximum.

exchanges.description: Array of exchange names to filter by (e.g., ["NYSE", "NASDAQ"]). If not specified or empty, no exchange filtering will be applied.

countries.description: Array of country codes to filter by (e.g., ["US", "CA"]). If not specified or empty, no country filtering will be applied.

sortBy.description: Field name to sort by. It should be one of fields you specify. If not specified, it will sort by the symbol name.

items.description: Flexible data object containing the requested fields

EconomicEventsResponseData.description: Economic events calendar response data schema

Fundamental.description: Fundamental data point with metadata and value

id.description: Unique identifier for the fundamental metric

name.description: Display name of the fundamental metric

group.description: Subcategory or grouping within the category

type.description: Data type of the fundamental value

period.description: Time period for the fundamental data

value.description: The actual fundamental value (only present in /v3/symbols/{symbol}/fundamentals endpoint)

FundamentalWithoutValue.description: Fundamental data point metadata without the value field

id.description: Unique identifier for the fundamental metric

name.description: Display name of the fundamental metric

group.description: Subcategory or grouping within the category

type.description: Data type of the fundamental value

period.description: Time period for the fundamental data

FundamentalsResponse.description: Response containing fundamental data with values

data.description: Array of fundamental data with values

last_update.description: The last update time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

FundamentalsMetaResponse.description: Response containing fundamental data's base structure without values and available individual indicators

base.description: Array of fundamental metadata without values

items.description: List of available individual fundamental indicators. This can be used at /v3/symbols/{symbol}/fundamentals/{id}

id.description: Unique identifier for the technical indicator

name.description: Display name of the technical indicator

items.description: List of available individual technical indicators. This can be used at /v3/symbols/{symbol}/fundamentals/{id}

last_update.description: The last update time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

FundamentalsSeriesResponse.description: Response containing fundamental time series data

last_update.description: The last update time in Unix timestamp (milliseconds)

total_items.description: Total number of fundamental indicators in response

name.description: Display name of the fundamental indicator

time.description: Unix timestamp (seconds) for the data point

close.description: The fundamental value for this time period

data.description: Historical time series data points for the fundamental indicator
Array of fundamental indicators with their historical data

SymbolPathParam.name: symbol
SymbolPathParam.description: Symbol in Exchange:Symbol format (e.g., NASDAQ:AAPL, NYSE:TSLA). You can search for this symbol code using the /v3/symbols/search endpoint.

BarIntervalParam.name: bar_interval
BarIntervalParam.description: (Optional) Bar intervals. The combination of bar_type and bar_interval must not exceed one year. Default is 1.

ExtendedParam.name: extended
ExtendedParam.description: (Optional) Extended hours (Not all assets support extended hours). Default to true.

DividendAdjustmentParam.name: dadj
DividendAdjustmentParam.description: (Optional) Dividend adjustment for equities and etfs (has no effect on assets without dividends). Default to false.

BackAdjustmentParam.name: badj
BackAdjustmentParam.description: (Optional) Back-adjustment for continous futures contracts (has no effect on non-continous futures data). Default to true.

RealtimeParam.name: long_poll
RealtimeParam.description: (Optional) If true, the server will wait up to 3 additional seconds for a real-time data before responding. Default is false.

WeekRangeParam.name: w
WeekRangeParam.description: Specifies the week range. For example, 1 means this week (starting today) through next week, 2 means next week through the following week, and so on.

DataPointsParam.name: dp
DataPointsParam.description: (Optional) Maximum number of data points to return. Higher values may increase latency. Default is 3000. Supported values: 1 - 25000

bearerAuth.description: Obtain Bearer token from the Dashboard. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {token}'

x-rapidapi-key.name: x-rapidapi-key
x-rapidapi-key.description: Use your RapidAPI key in the x-rapidapi-key header.
